name: Under the Indian Penal Code, words which refer to acts done, extend also to
nameText: Under the Indian Penal Code, words which refer to acts done, extend also to

options.name: Omissions
Illegal Omissions
Commissions
Illegal Commissions

solution: SECTION 32. WORDS REFFERING TO ACTS INCLUDE ILLEGAL OMISSIONS

name: The difference between section 34 and section 149 of Indian Penal Code is:
nameText: The difference between section 34 and section 149 of Indian Penal Code is:

options.name: that whereas in section 34 there must at atleast be five persons, section 149 requires only two persons
options.nameText: that whereas in section 34 there must at atleast be five persons, section 149 requires only two persons

options.name: that section 149 is only a rule of evidence whereas section 34 creates a specific offence and provides for its punishment
options.nameText: that section 149 is only a rule of evidence whereas section 34 creates a specific offence and provides for its punishment

options.name: that section 34 requires active participation in action whereas section 149 requires mere passive membership of the unlawful assembly
options.nameText: that section 34 requires active participation in action whereas section 149 requires mere passive membership of the unlawful assembly

options.name: that section 34 need not be joined with the principal of offence, whereas section 149 must be combined with the principal offence
options.nameText: that section 34 need not be joined with the principal of offence, whereas section 149 must be combined with the principal offence

solution:
SECTION 34. ACTS DONE BY SEVERAL PERSONS IN FURTHERANCE OF COMMON INTENTION

SECTION 149. EVERY MEMBER OF UNLAWFUL ASSEMBLY GUILTY OF OFFENCE COMMITTED IN PROSECUTION OF THE COMMON OBJECT

name: Y, a small boy was guarding the field. Z and M outsiders trespassed and stared harvesting, on protest by Y they beat him up and hearing his cries, X and P, uncles of Y who were working in different directions, rushed in, one of them X, fired at the trespassers killing one of them and ran away. P was arrested and charged under section 302 of IPC for murder read with section 34. Which of the following statements is correct?
nameText: Y, a small boy was guarding the field. Z and M outsiders trespassed and stared harvesting, on protest by Y they beat him up and hearing his cries, X and P, uncles of Y who were working in different directions, rushed in, one of them X, fired at the trespassers killing one of them and ran away. P was arrested and charged under section 302 of IPC for murder read with section 34. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.name: he is liable for murder because of the similar intention of both the brothers
options.nameText: he is liable for murder because of the similar intention of both the brothers

options.name: he is liable for murder because of the same intention of both the brothers
options.nameText: he is liable for murder because of the same intention of both the brothers

options.name: he is liable for murder because he was present when his brother forced at the trespassers
options.nameText: he is liable for murder because he was present when his brother forced at the trespassers

options.name: he is not liable because there was no common intention to kill
options.nameText: he is not liable because there was no common intention to kill

solution: SECTION 34. ACTS DONE BY SEVERAL PERSONS IN FURTHERANCE OF COMMON INTENTION

name: Section 34 of the IPC
nameText: Section 34 of the IPC

options.name: Creates a substantive offence
Introduces the principle of vicarious liability for an offence committed by the co-accused
options.nameText: Introduces the principle of vicarious liability for an offence committed by the co-accused

options.name: Recognizes that the co-participant in a crime must be made liable for his act in the commission of the crime by the co-accused
options.nameText: Recognizes that the co-participant in a crime must be made liable for his act in the commission of the crime by the co-accused

options.name: Both b and c

solution: SECTION 34. ACTS DONE BY SEVERAL PERSONS IN FURTHERANCE OF COMMON INTENTION

name: Five persons went to A’s house armed with bats to beat A. One (X) amongst the five persons was carrying a pistol concealed underneath his shirt.  During the incident of beating, X fired a shot resulting in A’s death:
nameText: Five persons went to A’s house armed with bats to beat A. One (X) amongst the five persons was carrying a pistol concealed underneath his shirt.  During the incident of beating, X fired a shot resulting in A’s death:

options.name: All being members of unlawful assembly are liable for causing death
options.nameText: All being members of unlawful assembly are liable for causing death

options.name: All will be liable only for beating A
options.nameText: All will be liable only for beating A

options.name: Only X will be liable for causing death
options.nameText: Only X will be liable for causing death

options.name: None of the above

solution: SECTION 149. EVERY MEMBER OF UNLAWFUL ASSEMBLY GUILTY OF OFFENCE COMMITTED IN PROSECUTION OF THE COMMON OBJECT

name: Three persons A, B & C went to a Bank.  A stood outside the bank holding a revolver with him and watching at the road.  B & C entered the bank and asked the cashier by showing revolvers at him, to handover the cash to them.  On the refusal to do so, C shot at the cashier and took away money from Counter. Now
nameText: Three persons A, B & C went to a Bank.  A stood outside the bank holding a revolver with him and watching at the road.  B & C entered the bank and asked the cashier by showing revolvers at him, to handover the cash to them.  On the refusal to do so, C shot at the cashier and took away money from Counter. Now

options.name: C is liable for the murder and A & B are liable for abetment
options.nameText: C is liable for the murder and A & B are liable for abetment

options.name: B & C are liable for murder and A is liable for abetment
options.nameText: B & C are liable for murder and A is liable for abetment

options.name: A, B & C are liable for murder
options.nameText: A, B & C are liable for murder

options.name: None of them is liable because it is not a murder but only culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
options.nameText: None of them is liable because it is not a murder but only culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

solution: SECTION 34. ACTS DONE BY SEVERAL PERSONS IN FURTHERANCE OF COMMON INTENTION
